snippet: Sales were estimated to have dropped to $50.9 billion from $57.4 billion last year, puzzling experts who predicted strong growth.
abstract: National Retail Federation reports that sales in stores and online from Thanksgiving Day through the weekend are estimated to have dropped 11 percent, to $50.9 billion, from $57.4 billion in 2013; web failed to attract more shoppers or spending over four-day holiday weekend than it did in 2013, despite fact that many retailers offered same aggressive discounts online as they did in stores.
lead_paragraph: Sales were estimated to have dropped to $50.9 billion from $57.4 billion last year, puzzling experts who predicted strong growth.

headline.main: Black Friday Fatigue? Thanksgiving Weekend Sales Slide 11 Percent
headline.print_headline: Holiday Weekend Sales Slide, Despite Bargains
